section.heading: Assistance of the United States Civil Service Commission in development of District merit system.
section.text: The United States Civil Service Commission is hereby authorized to advise and assist the Mayor and the Council in the further development of the merit system or systems required by § 1-204.22(3) and the said Commission is authorized to enter into agreements with the District government to make available its registers of eligibles as a recruiting source to fill District positions as needed. The costs of any specific services furnished by the Civil Service Commission may be compensated for under the provisions of § 1-207.31.

annoGroup.heading: References in Text
annoGroup.text: “§ 1-1131 (§ 1-207.31, 2001 Ed.)”, referred to at the end of the last sentence of this section, was repealed by § 5(b) of the Act of September 13, 1982, Pub. L. 97-258.
Present provisions similar to repealed § 1-207.31 are codified at 31 U.S.C.§ 1537.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Definitions applicable: The definitions contained in § 1-201.03 apply to this section.
